dcterms:creator: A. Sanchez-Gonzalez
V. Bapst
K. Cranmer
P. Battaglia
dcterms:description: Graph Network-based Simulator that builds on the encoder-processor-decoder approach, applied iteratively on the encoded space to simulate systems with up to 85k particles.
dcterms:title: GNS (Graph Network-based Simulator)

dcterms:creator: T. Pfaff
M. Fortunato
A. Sanchez-Gonzalez
P. Battaglia
dcterms:description: MeshGraphNets extend the Graph Network simulation with additional edges to define a mesh, allowing for adaptive remeshing to model a wider spectrum of dynamics.
dcterms:title: MeshGraphNets

dcterms:creator: R. A. Gingold
J. J. Monaghan
dcterms:description: Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) is a computational method for simulating fluid flows, discretizing the governing equations of fluid dynamics.
dcterms:title: Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH)

dcterms:creator: L. B. Lucy
dcterms:description: Molecular Dynamics (MD) is a simulation method that generates the trajectories of an N-body atomic system, based on Hamiltonian mechanics.
dcterms:title: Molecular Dynamics (MD)

dcterms:creator: P. Espanol
dcterms:description: Fluid Particle Model (FPM) is a mesoscopic Newtonian model situated between microscopic Molecular Dynamics and macroscopic Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics.
dcterms:title: Fluid Particle Model (FPM)

dcterms:creator: P. Hoogerbrugge
J. Koelman
dcterms:description: Dissipative Particle Dynamics (DPD) is a simulation method for microscopic hydrodynamic phenomena, incorporating noise to approximate physical systems.
dcterms:title: Dissipative Particle Dynamics (DPD)

dcterms:creator: W. Rokicki
E. Gawell
dcterms:description: Voronoi tessellation is a method used for optimizing architectural and structural rod structures through spatial partitioning.
dcterms:title: Voronoi tessellation
